channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Florida becomes second state to ban fluoride in public water
item.description: Florida has become the second state in the country — after Utah — to ban fluoridation of public water systems.

item.title: SCOTUSblog's Amy Howe discusses birthright citizenship case before the Supreme Court
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Amy Howe, a reporter with SCOTUSblog, about the issue of birthright citizenship and the use of universal injunctions before the Supreme Court.

item.title: Supreme Court justices seem divided in birthright citizenship arguments
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court seemed at least partially divided as the justices heard arguments debating how the lower courts should handle President Trump's executive order on birthright citizenship.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Supreme Court justices appear divided in birthright citizenship arguments, President Trump returns to Washington after Middle East trip, a look at week 1 of Sean 'Diddy' Combs' federal criminal trial.

item.title: Pulitzer Prize-winning biographer Ron Chernow discusses his new book, 'Mark Twain'
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Pulitzer Prize-winning biographer Ron Chernow about his new book, "Mark Twain," in which he illuminates the complex life of the writer.

item.title: Nashville mayor demands names of nearly 200 people detained by ICE
item.description: The mayor of Nashville is demanding the names of nearly 200 people detained by ICE during traffic stops in recent weeks. He worries some immigrants in the U.S. legally were arrested.

item.title: Charles Strouse, Broadway composer of 'Annie' and 'Bye Bye Birdie,' has died at 96
item.description: Broadway composer Charles Strouse, creator of the hit musicals Bye Bye Birdie, Applause and Annie, died at his home in New York City on Thursday.

item.title: Beige Book reports on impacts of Trump administration cuts
item.description: Regional banks in the Federal Reserve system study their local economies and publish those stories in a report called the Beige Book. The Kansas City Fed's has fallout from Trump administration cuts.

item.title: A case similar to the prosecution of the Wisconsin judge is ongoing in Massachusetts
item.description: A Wisconsin judge is charged with helping an undocumented immigrant evade federal agents. It's a rare prosecution but not unheard of — a similar case unfolded seven years ago in Massachusetts.

item.title: President Trump returns to Washington after four-day Gulf trip
item.description: President Trump returns to Washington Friday after a four-day tour through the Gulf where he struck business deals and was treated like royalty by the leaders of Saudi Arabia, Qatar and the UAE.
